result.execSummary:
The defendant Stanford W Lightfoot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
May transfer probation to the State of Georgia.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

No Contact with any co-defendant's or victims listed in the criminal complaint. Not to use or possess any checks or checking account except for any check issued to him in his name. Not to travel out of the state of Georgia unless given permission by agent. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Court orders removal of the GPS monitoring. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Sentence credit of 69 days were granted. Last 111 Days to be STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

of statement made by special agent in court on 8/7/15 filed by the state

Defendant Stanford W Lightfoot in court with Attorney Mark P. Powers.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State files transcript regarding postal agent's statements regarding this crime.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Powers makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

 3 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -    2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS      **Transfer allowed to State of Georgia** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling/obtain GED/HSED  
____No contact with: any Co-Defendant's or victims listed in criminal complaint 
____Not to use or possess any checks/checking account (except for any check issued to him in his name)
____Not to travel out of the state of Georgia unless given permission by agent 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted - remainder to be refunded to poster)

CONDITION TIME:  180 Days (69 Days credit), Non-working hours with standard release conditions - last 111 Days STAYED-to be used at agent's discretion 

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

NOTE:  Court orders removal of GPS monitoring
Sentencing hearing on August 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on August 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.
(Fax) Dated 07/30/15, from Atty Powers to Judge Carter, requesting sentencing date.

Endorsement on Warrant & Return of Officer

Criminal Complaint
Review hearing on August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant must reside with his father, Stanford Lightfoot, at 4350 Sun Valley Boulevard in East Point, GA  30344.  Defendant is to report to the Waukesha County District Attorney's office 5 days before any evidentiary hearing and remain in Waukesha County until the evidentiary mater has concluded, or a material witness warrant will be issued for his arrest and extradition.  Any additional applicable charges will be filed.  Defendant is not to discuss this case with anyone other than his attorney and his father.  Defendant to have no contact with any Co-Defendant or known family of a Co-Defendant.  Defendant is not to leave the State of Georgia unless it is to come back to Wisconsin for court appearances.  To ensure this, Defendant agrees to be monitored by GPS during the pendency of this case.  Defendant is to have GPS installed within 48 hours of arrival in the State of Georgia through A & A Monitor Service at 359 W. Pike Street- Lawrenceville, GA  30046  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is to report to WCS immediately upon release from custody.  NOTE:  DEFENDANT MUST ALSO POST $1,500.00 CASH BAIL IN ADDITION TO THIS  CO-SIGNED BOND BY HIS FATHER, STANFORD LIGHTFOOT.

Defendant Stanford W Lightfoot in court, in custody, with attorney Andrew R Rider.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing with 15CF539 and 15CF542.  Village of Elm Grove Assistant Police Chief Jason Hennen sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Nickolie.  Cross examination by Attorney Sonderhouse.  Cross examination by Attorney Rider.  Cross examination by Attorney Klein.  Village of Elm Grove Detective Craig Mayer sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Nickolie.  Cross examination by Attorney Sonderhouse.  Cross examination by Attorney Rider. Cross examination by Attorney Klein.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Defense moves for dismissal.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Attorney Rider requests a bail modification.  State would object to any bail modification.   The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
